quizSrc.term: 3.5.4.2, Consider the following reflection from a university course in Education. Note that this particular reflection had a word limit of 200-550 words, and students were instructed to reflect on the idea of being a critically reflective teacher. Stephen Brookfield (1995), in his analysis of why critical reflection is important to teaching, suggests that "an uncritical stance towards our practice sets us up for a lifetime of frustration" (para. 2).
